Articles.Content:
Just a quick question regarding cleaning up my KSP mods directory, both to make things easier to handle for my not very up to date PC and in order to reduce the clutter in the VAB/SPH parts menus.

There are a lot of parts I probably won't ever use, but there are some parts I want to keep.

Question:

Is it usually safe to remove selected parts ( in each mod's \parts\ directory) without essentially breaking them ?

Or do the mod DLLs usually load/check if these are present?

Examples: some KAS parts (some huge sized ones)

Removing the part config (*.cfg file) should do the trick from what I understand. It's also a safe way to ensure that shared models (engine shrouds, for instance) don't get removed from parts you want them on.
